1: <sup>1</sup> Deliver me from mine enemies, O my God: defend me from them that rise up against me.
2: <sup>2</sup> Deliver me from the workers of iniquity, and save me from bloody men.
3: <sup>3</sup> For, lo, they lie in wait for my soul: the mighty are gathered against me; not for my transgression, nor for my sin, O LORD.
4: <sup>4</sup> They run and prepare themselves without my fault: awake to help me, and behold.
5: <sup>5</sup> Thou therefore, O LORD God of hosts, the God of Israel, awake to visit all the heathen: be not merciful to any wicked transgressors. Selah.
6: <sup>6</sup> They return at evening: they make a noise like a dog, and go round about the city.
7: <sup>7</sup> Behold, they belch out with their mouth: swords are in their lips: for who, say they, doth hear?
8: <sup>8</sup> But thou, O LORD, shalt laugh at them; thou shalt have all the heathen in derision.
9: <sup>9</sup> Because of his strength will I wait upon thee: for God is my defence.
10: <sup>10</sup> The God of my mercy shall prevent me: God shall let me see my desire upon mine enemies.
11: <sup>11</sup> Slay them not, lest my people forget: scatter them by thy power; and bring them down, O Lord our shield.
12: <sup>12</sup> For the sin of their mouth and the words of their lips let them even be taken in their pride: and for cursing and lying which they speak.
13: <sup>13</sup> Consume them in wrath, consume them, that they may not be: and let them know that God ruleth in Jacob unto the ends of the earth. Selah.
14: <sup>14</sup> And at evening let them return; and let them make a noise like a dog, and go round about the city.
15: <sup>15</sup> Let them wander up and down for meat, and grudge if they be not satisfied.
16: <sup>16</sup> But I will sing of thy power; yea, I will sing aloud of thy mercy in the morning: for thou hast been my defence and refuge in the day of my trouble.
17: <sup>17</sup> Unto thee, O my strength, will I sing: for God is my defence, and the God of my mercy.
